options: a. The controlling of all traffic close to an aerodrome.
b. The controlling of all traffic in Class F airspace.
c. The controlling of all traffic in Class F & G airspace.
d. The controlling of IFR traffic.

In class C airspace, what flights are separated?

c. IFR from IFR; VFR from IFR and VFR from VFR.
d. IFR from IFR; IFR from VFR; VFR from IFR.

questions.question: What service is provided to IFR/VFR traffic in class E airspace?
options: a. ATC to IFR and VFR.
b. ATC to IFR; FIS to VFR.
c. ATC to IFR and radio equipped VFR; FIS to non radio VFR.
d. ATC to IFR; Advisory ATC to IFR in VMC; FIS to VFR.

questions.question: A Control Zone has to exist to at least:
options: a. 5 NM from the centre of the airfield or airfields concerned in the direction from where approaches can be made.
b. 20 NM from the centre of the airfield or airfields concerned in the direction from where approaches can be made.
c. 15 NM from the centre of the airfield or airfields concerned in the direction from where approaches can be made.
d. 10 NM from the centre of the airfield or airfields concerned in the direction from where approaches can be made.

questions.question: A Flight Information Service shall be provided to all aircraft which are likely to be affected by the information which are:
options: a. provided with ATC or otherwise known to the relevant ATS unit.

c. known to the relevant ATS units only.
d. known to the relevant ATS unit or have filed a flight plan.

questions.question: An RNP1 route designated with suffix Z indicates that for the route at or below FL190 and all turns shall be made within the allowable RNP tolerance of a tangential arc between the straight leg segments with a radius of:

d. 30 NM for turns between 30° and 90°.

c. 22.5 NM for turns between 30° and 90°
d. 30 NM for turns between 30° and 90°.

questions.question: Who organizes the RNP specification for airspace?
